org.pragmaticminds.crunch.execution

Class TimestampSortFunction<T extends Serializable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pragmaticminds.crunch.execution.TimestampSortFunction<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, SortFunction<Long,T>

    public class TimestampSortFunction<T extends Serializable>
extends Object
implements SortFunction<Long,T>
    This class implements the SortFunction interface based on Long type timestamps. All incoming values are processed by the process(Long, Long, Serializable) function and stored into an internal queue. A Timer is than calling the onTimer(Long) method to collect all values that are over the given watermark timestamp.
    Author:
    Erwin Wagasow Created by Erwin Wagasow on 02.10.2018
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Collection<T> onTimer(Long watermark)
      This method is called by a timer, that periodically collects results from the internal queue, that are over the watermark timestamp and are ready to be processed.
      void process(Long timestamp, Long watermark, T value)
      Takes a value into the internal queue, if they are not older than the peek value of the queue, otherwise the value is discarded.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        public void process(Long timestamp,
                    Long watermark,
                    T value)
        Takes a value into the internal queue, if they are not older than the peek value of the queue, otherwise the value is discarded.
        Specified by:
        process in interface SortFunction<Long,T extends Serializable>
        Parameters:
        timestamp - relevant timestamp for sorting.
        watermark - relevant watermark timestamp as the top limit for adding new values to the queue.
        value - to be sorted by timestamp.

      • onTimer

        public Collection<T> onTimer(Long watermark)
        This method is called by a timer, that periodically collects results from the internal queue, that are over the watermark timestamp and are ready to be processed.
        Specified by:
        onTimer in interface SortFunction<Long,T extends Serializable>
        Parameters:
        watermark - timestamp, that indicates which queued values are ready to be processed in the next step, which are all values with the timestamp <= watermark timestamp.
        Returns:
        a Collection of all values with a timestamp over the given watermark timestamp.
